intro: Cryptantha virginensis, commonly known as the Virginia cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the spring, typically from April to June. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Cryptantha virginensis thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks.
